oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WIND SPECIFICATION FOR SPECTRAL OCEAN-WAVE MODELS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Khandekar, M.L.
Eid, B.M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave model
wind waves
wave spectrum
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper investigates the utility of winds obtainable from a numerical weather prediction model for driving a spectral ocean-wave model in an operational mode. Wind inputs for two operational spectral wave models were analyzed with respect to observed winds at three locations in the Canadian east coast offshore. Also, significant wave heights obtainable from the two spectral models were evaluated against measured wave data at these locations. Based on this analysis, the importance of appropriate wind specification for operational wave analysis and forecasting is demonstrated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 28
